snippet.title: Hyperloop One's passenger pod almost hit 200 mph in its latest test
snippet.content:
Startup Hyperloop One had another successful test of its Hyperloop technology.
On Saturday, Hyperloop One completed its second successful test to-date on its 500-meter development track in Nevada, the company said. The startup said the system travelled 315 feet and reached a top speed of 192 mph. The vehicle coasted above the track using magnetic levitation.
Hyperloop One's in mid-July was much slower; it only reached 70 mph and travelled for 5.3 seconds.
The Hyperloop is a nascent transportation system that works by shooting pods through a vacuumed-sealed tube at speeds that experts say could reach 700 mph. The concept was popularised in 2013 when Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk released a "" outlining how the system will work.
Hyperloop still has some ways to go to demonstrate a system that can connect cities.
The startup currently has feasibility studies under way in and Hyperloop One has also said it is in talks with regulators and city officials about .
The futuristic transit system is also being pursued by Hyperloop One's ousted cofounder, .
Musk said in July his latest venture, The Boring Company, has received "" to build a Hyperloop between New York and Washington DC, but with the proposal.
